title: TOILET PAPER
text: South Park Elementary, day. A new classroom. As the camera follows a new teacher around, the following kids are seen working with clay. Clyde presses the pottery wheel pedal as Bebe molds a vase on the wheel. Wendy watches. Tweek, Red, and Pip work on clay on the table near the wall. In the foreground, Token presses the pottery wheel pedal as Jordan molds a vase. Butters, Kevin, and another kid work on their own projects. Kenny, Stan, Kyle and Cartman are laughing at their project, which didn't require the use of the pottery wheel.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Okay. Good, children, good. Remember to feel the clay. Be one with the clay. Nice. Uh huh.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Put more clay on the balls.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Boys!  What is that?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: A reindeer?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: You know, I've had it! You four boys never take art class seriously!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: What a crime.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: You think art is not important?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Weelll, art is just kinda... for gaywads.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: I love our class!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: See?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Do you think this is funny?!  Do you think this is funny, huh?!  Well, you four can just spend your afternoon after school here making new pottery!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: You can't do that!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: I certainly can! I'm your teacher!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: You're an art teacher!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Make it two hours!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Cut to after school. The art teacher sits at her desk watching the boys work on a proper vase on the pottery wheel. Kyle is pressing the pedal. The boys are angry at their teacher

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Mrs. Dreible thinks she's so cool!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: How dare she talk to us like that?!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: (Yeah, how the fuck is that?!)

title: TOILET PAPER
text: We can't let her get away with this! I think tonight we need to do something drastic.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Like what?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Like find out where Mrs. Dreible lives, and go over there, and... TP her house.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: (Yeah!)

title: TOILET PAPER
text: TP her house?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Toilet paper! Cover her house in toilet paper.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Oh.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: What's the matter, Kyle? You chicken? Ugh!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Quiet, boys. This isn't playtime, you're being punished!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Fine! But we'll have the last laugh tonight, artwhore!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Yeah! Payback time, you ugly skank!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Henry's Supermarket, day. A man watches his son ride in a coin-operated ride outside the store. Inside, the four boys approach checkout line 3 with two carts stacked high with packages of Kush Tush toilet paper.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: D'you think that's enough?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Should be fine.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Don't you guys think this is a little suspicious? We should buy something else so it doesn't look obvious.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Okay.  Here we go, pack of chewing gum.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Hello boys. Find everything you need?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Yep. All set.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Mokay, let's see here. Toilet paper Toilet paper  Toilet paper  Toilet paper  Toilet paper  So, what are you kids up to tonight?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Oh, we're just gonna watch some TV, maybe play a board game.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Nice relaxing night at home, huh? Toilet paper  Toilet paper  Aaand toilet paper Eh, hey.  Now you kids be careful with this chewing gum.Don't go sticking it under tables.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Okay.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Okay. Toilet paper  Toilet paper  Tooilet paper  You know, son, I rmember you comin' in last week and buying this much toilet paper.

text: Heh yeah, that that's right.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: ... Toilet paper  Toilet paper

title: TOILET PAPER
text: You TP'ed a house last week, Cartman?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: No. Last Thursday night was fajitas night.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Oh.  Uuugh.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Mrs. Dreible's house, later, that night. The boys walk up to the house carrying black trash bags of toilet paper

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Is this the right house?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: It's the right address-wait! Look there! There's Mrs. Dreible! This is the place.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Oh wait, wait, there's kids inside.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: So?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: So we're not TP'ing a house with kids inside it!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Kyle, we all agreed to do this!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: We didn't say nothin' about no kids, man!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Kyle, you're bein' an asshole! Now let's do this thing and get out of m'yeah. Here's what I think of your art class, you God-damned bitch!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: (Yeah! Fuck you!)

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Majestic music plays as Kenny unleashes his roll. Stan unleashes a roll. Cartman tosses off another one and grins. More rolls of paper fly onto the roof. Kyle tosses up a roll, unsure of doing so. Stan unleashes another one, and his glee is unabashed. Kenny tosses off another one. More and more rolls fly over the roof. Kyle freezes in awe of their vandalism. Toilet paper covers the house, the garage, and the trees around the house. The boys head for the sidewalk

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Come on, let's go!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: What have we done?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Let's go, Kyle!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: The bus stop

title: TOILET PAPER
text: We're, we're in trouble. We're in sooo much trouble.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Aw man, that was sooo awesome!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: How can you say that? Did you see what we did to their house?! It'll take them days to clean that up!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Who cares??

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Well, YOU don't, because you're a non-caring asshole, Cartman!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Me??  There's toilet paper on your hands, too, Kyle.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Cartman's right, Kyle. We're all in this together.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Kyle's house, after bedtime. Kyle's room. He is asleep, but begins to have nightmares

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Noo! No.  Noo!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: AAAAAAAAA!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Honey, what is it?? Oh, Jesus no! Our house!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Mommy! Mommy!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Whyyy? Whyyy?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Ah! Oh God! Oh God!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: South Park Elementary, next day. The kids are in their regular classroom chatting, waiting for class to begin.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Hey, uh, you guys here what happened last night? Mrs. Dreible's house got covered with toilet paper.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Yeah. They say it's gonna take three weeks to get it all down.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Yeah? Well, Ol' Mrs. Dreible probably had it comin' to her.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: I don't know. I don't think anybody deserves that kind of brutality.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Well, I understand the people who did it weren't caughts, so-o... Looks like nobody will ever know the geniuses who masterminded that perfect crime.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Okay children, let's take our seats. Oh, uh, Stan, Kyle, Eric, and Kenny, the counselor wants to see you in his office, now.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Damn!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Oh God!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Outside the counselor's office. The boys sit on chairs next to the door - the bench is gone. Kyle looks around nervously

title: TOILET PAPER
text: How the hell did they find out it was us that TP'ed that house?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Will you relax, Kyle?! They have nothing on us! As long as we all stick to our story, we'll be fine.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: We'd better go over our story again so we don't screw it up.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Okay. Last night, all four of us were at the bowling alley until about 7:30, at which time we noticed Ally Sheedy, the Goth chick from the Breakfast Club, was bowling in the lane next to us, and we asked her for her autograph, but she didn't have a pen, so we followed her out to her car, but on the way we were accosted by five Scientologists who wanted to give us all personality tests, which were administered at the Scientology Center in Denver until 10:45, at which time we accidentally boarded the wrong bus home and ended up in Rancho de Burritos Rojos, south of Castle Rock, and finally got a ride home with a man who was missing his left index finger, named Gary Bushwell, arriving home at 11:46.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: I'm confused. Did Ally Sheedy take that personality test?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Yes, dude!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Kyle, it's very simple: we followed Ally Sheedy out to her car, but on the way we were accosted by five Scientologists who wanted to give us all personality tests, which were administered at the Scientology Center in Denver until 10:45, at which time we accidentally boarded the wrong bus home and ended up in Rancho de Burritos Rojos, south of Castle Rock, and finally got a ride home with a man who was missing his left index finger, named Gary Bushwell, arriving home at 11:46, you got it??

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Ah, Ah I, ah I thought...

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Oh, for Christ's sake!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Look, Kyle, just let Cartman do all the talking, okay? He's better at being in trouble than anybody.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Thank you, Stan.  Sh sh, here they come, here they come.  "And so I said, 'That's a terrific joke, Wendy. Tell us another one.'" Oh, hello, Mr. Mackey. Are you ready to see us now?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: We're gonna talk to you one at a time, boys, m'kay? Kenny, will you step into my office, please?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Come on, Kenny, let's go, 'k?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Touché, Mr. Mackey, touché.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Why are they doing us one at a time?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: They want to see if we mix the story up, and see if someone will rat out the other three for a better deal.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: I can get a better deal?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Kyle, so help me God, if you Jew us out on this one, I will fucking kill you!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: The Dreible house. Mr. Dreible is removing the toilet paper from the trees and house with a broom. He's already filled two trash bags of toilet paper and is filling a third.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: There we go. That should be about the last of it.  Ex- excuse me, uh, wha-what are you doing?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Crime scene investigation!  There are several footprints in the snow. Perhaps more than one perpetrator?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Ah... look, we really don't wanna make a big deal out of this.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Is that the toilet paper there? I'll need to take those bags as evidence.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Lo-ih ih it's just not that big a deal, I mean, I toilet-papered houses myself when I was a kid.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: You?! So where were you last night at around 9?!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: I was here.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Aha!! Got you!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Officer, why would I TP my own house?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Insurance?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: It wasn't me, okay? Now, if you don't mind, I just wanna get my yard back to normal.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Now you listen to me! Whoever TP'ed your house is still out there roaming the streets. It's only a matter of time before another house and another family is victimized! I have to stop that from happening.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: You really have nothing better to do, do you?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: No I do not.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Kyle's house, after bedtime. Kyle's room. He is asleep, but the nightmares return

title: TOILET PAPER

title: TOILET PAPER

text: Hello, Kyle. Going somewhere?

text: Oh. Okay. Thanks.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Park County Juvenile Hall, day. Inside, the warden leads Officer Barbrady to Cell Block 4.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Josh Meyers TP'ed over six hundred houses in less than a year.  He's a real monster.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: I just need to talk to someonen who knows how toilet paperers think.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Just remember: he'd toilet-paper you in a second if he had the chance.  He's the last cell on your left.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Hello, Josh. My name is Officer Barbrady. I'm with the South Park police.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: That's a terrible cologne you're wearing, officer. You should try something more... casual.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: I was hoping you could help me solve a toilet-papering case?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: And why would I do that? Because I'm such a charming fella?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Uh please, I need your help. What would you want in return?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Due to the harsh nature of my crimes they don't allow me to have toilet paper in my cell. You can imagine how bothersome that becomes.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: You... know I can't give you toilet paper, Josh.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Nno, but it was worth a try, doesn't it?  Tell me something, officer: why is it that you police such a small town. You must have had larger inspirations. What happened to those... big-city dreams?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Well, that's kind of personal.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Quid pro quo, officer. Tell me what I want to know. And I'll help you catch whoever toilet-papered that house.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Look kid, I have very little time to catch whoever toilet-papered that house. Tell me what you know.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Are those the crime scene photos? Let me see them.  Yes. Yes. Not bad work, not bad at all. These toilet-paperers are professional, at least one of them is.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: So you think there was more than one. Why?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Tell me something first. When you went to the academy you had something to prove. You wanted to protect and serve, but mostly you wanted to protect yourself. Who were you protecting yourself from, Officer Barbrady?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Oh all right, all right, my uncle Charles used to hit me with a belt!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Thank you. Your toilet-paperers are most like males between the ages of 8 and 10 and probably virgins. Parents notice that much toilet paper missing, so they would have to have bought it themselves. Find out where the toilet paper came from, officer, and you just might catch your man.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: South Park Elementary, day. Kids are moving towards their classes, passing each other in the process. Stan and Kenny are talking with Clyde, Craig, and Kevin

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Stan, Kenny, can I talk to you guys for a second?  I think we have the counselor and the principal fooled, but we need to talk about Kyle.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: What about him?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Come on, you know. He's losing it. He's gonna crack.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: (I think so too.)

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Kyle can't take the heat; he's gonna sing like a canary. Then we're all gonna take the fall for what we did.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Ha-ey fellas.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Butters.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Look you guys, all it takes is for one of us to crack, and we all know who the weakest link is!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: So what should we do?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: We have no choice. We have to kill Kyle.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: ... Dude, we're not killing Kyle!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: (Yeah!)

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Why not?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Kyle's not gonna say anything, alright?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: He almost spilled the beans in the counselor's office! He can't even keep the story straight! I'm telling you guys, he's weak. He's weak, and he'll be the end of all of us.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: South Park Police Department

title: TOILET PAPER
text: You wanted to see me, Officer Barbrady?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Yes, thanks for coming, Mr. Bell. A house was TP'ed in South Park and I need to see if you can identify the toilet paper I recovered from the scene. I'm... sorry I have to do this.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Oh my God.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Is this toilet paper from your store?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: It's... difficult to tell, it's... so decayed, I... wait a minute, yes. Yes, I recognize the floral pattern now.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Positive ID on the toilet paper.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Who would... do this to toilet paper? Who?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Mr. Bell, do you remember anyone suspicious buying toilet paper in the last few days?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Suspicious like how?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Well, like someone who was black or Mexican or Middle Eastern.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Nnoo, the only Mexican guy I recall bought toasted tarts and chips and... we don't allow Middle Eastern people in the store.  Oh my God!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Stark's Pond, night. A low fog moves over the surface of the water

title: TOILET PAPER
text: What's this all about, Cartman?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: I just wanted to see how you're doing, Kyle. Why don't we go out for a little boat ride?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: A boat ride?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: I just thought we should find a private place to... talk.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Well, okay.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Could you help me put this cement block and chain in the boat?  Okay, let's go.  So how are things, Kyle?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Terrible. Every time I close my eyes I see the house we TP'ed. I see the tears of our art teacher and hear the screams of her daughters.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: And you feel like you have to confess.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: I don't know what to do.  Part of me feels like I wanna end it all now. Tell people what heppened. You know, I never knew how beautiful this pond was before.  So cold. The world can feel like that.  So calm on the outside, as if nothing bad ever happens.  Ow. What the hell are you doing, Cartman?!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: I'm killing you. But unfortunately I could only afford a Wiffle ball bat, so it's gonna take a while.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Cartman!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Don't fight it, Kyle, it will only take longer. Just slip into sweet unconsciousness.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: You wanna kill me?! Fine!  I can't live like this anymore! Go ahead! Do it!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Won't be long, Kyle.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Juvenile Hall, day. Barbrady returns to Cell Block 4

text: Josh, I need your help.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: The answer is right in front of you, but you can't see it.

text: How do you mean?

text: Tell me, the toilet paper. Was it quilted?

text: Yes.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: No, two-ply.  What? What does that tell you?

text: Why does one toilet-paper houses

text: To get revenge.

text: No, that is incidental. Your toilet-paperers wanted to transform the art teacher's house, thus transforming her entire occupation.

text: What do you mean?

text: Your uncle, who hit you with a belt. Was he a large man?

text: Alright alright my dad dressed me up like a little girl on poker nights and he made me sit on all my uncles' laps!

text: Whoa. Uh, oh. Thank you. Your toilet-paperers are most likely students in the art teacher's class, students who aren't very good at art.

text: Oh. Of course! One of her students!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Fly along now, Officer Barbrady. You've got some arrests to make.  Fly fly flyyy. Fly fly flyyy.

text: Josh,  were you doing the silly voice for the policeman again?

text: No, sir.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Stark's pond, night. Cartman is still whacking away at Kyle, in vain. Stan and Kenny come up in a pedal-powered boat. Both of them are pedaling. Stan looks over

text: Cartman, what are you doing?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: I'm getting rid of our problem. Kyle will be dead in a matter of hours.

text: You don't have to kill Kyle, dude. The police made an arrest. And the person confessed!

text: They did?

text: They did?

title: TOILET PAPER

title: TOILET PAPER
text: But can I still kill Kyyyle?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: South Park Police Department, day. The boys head for the station and enter

text: Hello boys. How are you?

text: We heard that you have the person who TP'ed the art teacher's house? Is that true?

text: Uh, can we see them-him-her?

text: Right over here.  Yeah, we interrogated the suspect for over forty hours, and he finally cracked.

text: Hey fellas!

text: Butters?

text: Yep. I'm in jail.

text: Uh huh. Unh, they said I TP'ed the art teacher's house.  I don't seem to remember it,  but they're pretty sure it was me.  I just can't get my behavior under control!

text: His parents are on their way down now.

text: You guys, we can't let him do this!

text: What are you talking about? This is a gift from God. An early Easter present all wrapped up in a pretty ribbon from Jesus Christ himself!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Well I'm just a little asshole, is what I am. When God made me, he must have not been payin' very close attention, 'cause I turned out wrong! Just plain wrong!

text: Officer Barbrady, Butters didn't TP that house.

text: Because it was-

text: Wiffle ball, anyone?  Anyone care for a nice game of Wiffle ball?

text: You know, it's not my parents I'm worried about. It's my girlfriend, Carrie. Why, she lives in Michigan. But when she finds out about this, woooo smokey, is she gonna be sore! She might even break up with me. And it would serve me right, too.

text: All right, boys, visiting time is over. Thanks for stopping by.

text: South Park Police Department, outside. The boys leave the station

title: TOILET PAPER
text: You see guys, it all worked itself out. Tadow, tadow, how you like me now? Feel a little silly now, Kyle? Tadow, how you like me now?

text: Bu... ...eh... Kyle, you don't seem to understand. We're we're not gonna get punished for this. Ever.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: I know.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: So... so then, how can you feel bad?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: He feels guilty for doing it and for letting someone else pay for it.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: ...But he's not gonna get in trouble.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: It doesn't matter if you get in trouble of not, you can still feel bad.  I think you're right, Kyle. Maybe we should confess.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: (Yeah, maybe we should.)

title: TOILET PAPER
text: What?? Eh...  hey you guys! There's nothing to feel bad about! We're, we're off scot-free!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: We feel bad for other people.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: For oth-er...  Uh. Oww. ...Ih ...Ih, ih, is it that ...you think you might get in trouble later?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Tomorrow in school we'll all tell the teacher it was us, and let her decide what to do.  And Cartman, if you had any thread of a conscience at all, you'll do the same!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Eh buh... eh... eh... Freakin' weirdos, man!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: South Park Police Department. The Stotches arrive at the police station and charge in

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Well well well! I had to see it to believe it!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Hi, Dad.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Don't you "Hi, Dad" me! Look at you! Standing behind prison bars! Again!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Yeahhh.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: What fibs have you been telling this policeman, Butters?! You know damn well you didn't toilet-paper that house!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Huh??

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Butters was with us all night, Officer Barbrady.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Butters, what have we told you about confessing to crimes you didn't commit?! We have had it, mister!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Well, he kept accusin' me for hours, and then he shot me up with sodium pentathol.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: And that's your excuse?!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Well, looks like I made a mistake. I... guess I'd better let you out now.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Just wait till we get you home, you little fibber!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Officer, can I stay in jail, please?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: The woods near Stark's Pond, evening. Eric appears and calls out to people behind him

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Come on, you guys! Hurry!  Guys, hurry!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: What is it, Cartmam?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: It's over this way! Come on!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Stark's Pond, later. Cartman rows the small boat to the middle of the lake, as he did before with Kyle. Lonely music plays, as before

title: TOILET PAPER
text: So how are things, guys?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Cartman, we're confessing tomorrow in school, and that's final.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: I'm afraid I can't let that happen.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: You can't kill all three of us, Cartman!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Can't I?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: South Park Elementary, next day. Officer Barbrady enters the principal's office.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Excuse me, everyone.  I have someone with me who can tell us all who toilet-papered the art teacher's house!  Josh insisted he be able to tell you the names of the toilet paperers in person.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Uh, that's nice, Officer Barbrady, but we actually don't need to know-

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Hold it!  Principal Victoria, Mr. Mackey, Mrs. Dreible. We have something we need to tell you.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: All right. Will you people stop barging into my office, please?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: What's the matter, Principal Victoria? Was your mother abusive? Did she spank your thighs with cold cuts and stick umbrellas up your ass?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Get him out of here!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Uh, Policeman Brown, will you take Josh outside, please?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Ooo, Polceman Brown, never quite made officer. Why is that, Polceman Brown?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: We have to confess that we were the ones that-

title: TOILET PAPER
text: It's too late, boys, m'kay? We already know everything.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: You, you do? How?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Hi guys.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Cartman??

title: TOILET PAPER
text: I told them everything, you guys. It's over.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Luckily for us, one of you had enough of a conscience to come forward.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: My consciences just caught up with me.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: That's not fair!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: You all get two weeks of detention, except Eric, who gets one week for being brave.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: But, but he's lying! He doesn't have a conscience!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Well, I guess my work here is done. After all this, I'm gonna need a long vacation.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: This was supposed to be my story! My coming to terms with a guilty conscience! This isn't fair!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: South Park Elementary, hallway outside the principal's office

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Okay, Josh, time to go back to the... Oh no!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: He... He was too fast for me. He ran out the door!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Couldn't you have gone after him?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Well, ah I'm covered in toilet paper. I'd look silly.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: South Park Elementary cafeteria, after school. Mr. Mackey addresses the detained. The boys are there, as well as two of the sixth graders, and Craig and Bebe

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Welcome to detention. You will be here till five o'clock, so make good study use of your time. M'kay?

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Wugh! Two weeks of this!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Yeah. But I have to say, I feel a lot better now.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: I know what you mean, Kyle. I realize now that even though you might not get caught doing something bad, you can still get caught later.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Oh Jesus!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: I didn't feel bad before, but now I just feel terrible.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: You just feel bad for yourself that you're in detention!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Right. I guess I learned today that sometimes you-

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Oh, stop it, Cartman! You didn't learn anything! Not a God-damned thing!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Hm.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: South Park Police Department, afternoon. Barbrady stands at his desk. The phone rings and he answers it.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Police station.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Hello Officer Barbrady.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Josh? Josh, where are you?!

title: TOILET PAPER
text: An undisclosed location, day

title: TOILET PAPER
text: I'm afraid that giving away my location might be harmful to my freedom, officer. I just wanted to thank you for helping me get out of that dingy cell.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: South Park Police Department

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Josh, you have to go back to Juvenile Hall. You only have a three-week sentence.

title: TOILET PAPER
text: the undisclosed location, day

title: TOILET PAPER
text: Sorry, officer, gotta run. There's something I've been meaning to do for quite some time. Ciao.
